name: Mule Core
description: Mule Runtime and Integration Platform: Core components

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: The name of the flow to call

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.name: flowRef
operations.description: Allows a 'flow' to be referenced such that the message processing will continue in the referenced flow before returning. Message processing in the referenced 'flow' will occur within the context of the referenced flow and will therefore use its exception strategy etc.

parameters.name: idExpression
parameters.description: Defines one or more expressions to use when extracting the ID from the message. If this property is not set, '#[id]' will be used by default.

parameters.name: valueExpression
parameters.description: Defines one or more expressions to use when extracting the value from the message.

parameters.name: objectStore
parameters.description: The object store where the IDs of the processed events are going to be stored.

parameters.name: storePrefix
parameters.description: Defines the prefix of the object store names. This will only be used for the internally built object store.

operations.name: idempotentMessageValidator
operations.description: Ensures that only unique messages are received by a service by checking the unique ID of the incoming message. Note that the ID used can be generated from the message using an expression defined in the 'idExpression' attribute. Otherwise, a 'FILTERED' error is generated.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message that will be logged. Embedded expressions can be used to extract value from the current message. If no message is specified then the current message is used.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The logging level to be used. Default is DEBUG.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The log category to be used

operations.name: logger
operations.description: Performs logging using an expression that determines what should be logged. By default the current messages is logged using the DEBUG level to the 'org.mule.runtime.core.api.processor.LoggerMessageProcessor' category but the level and category can both be configured to suit your needs. message is specified then the current message is used.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: An expression to that returns a java collection, object array, map or DOM nodes.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: An expression to that returns a java collection, object array, map or DOM nodes.

parameters.name: rootMessageVariableName
parameters.description: Property name where the parent message is stored.

parameters.name: counterVariableName
parameters.description: Property name used to store the number of message being iterated.

parameters.name: ignoreErrorType
parameters.description: A comma separated list of error types that should be handled, so that items that cause them when being processed are ignored, rather than propagating the error. This is useful to use validations inside this component.

constructs.name: foreach
constructs.description: The foreach Processor allows iterating over a collection payload, or any collection obtained by an expression, generating a message for each element.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression to evaluate.

constructs.name: choice
constructs.description: Sends the message to the first message processor whose condition has been satisfied. If no conditions were satisfied, sends to the configured default message processor if configured, or throws an exception if not configured.

parameters.name: handlerName
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: when
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The full name of the error type to match against or a comma separated list of full names, to match against any of them.

parameters.name: logException
parameters.description: Determines whether the handled exception will be logged to its standard logger in the ERROR level before being handled. Default is true.

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Determines whether ExceptionNotifications will be fired from this strategy when an exception occurs. Default is true.

nestedComponents.name: onErrorContinue
nestedComponents.description: Error handler used to handle exceptions. It will commit any transaction as if the message was consumed successfully.

parameters.name: handlerName
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: when
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The full name of the error type to match against or a comma separated list of full names, to match against any of them.

parameters.name: logException
parameters.description: Determines whether the handled exception will be logged to its standard logger in the ERROR level before being handled. Default is true.

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Determines whether ExceptionNotifications will be fired from this strategy when an exception occurs. Default is true.

nestedComponents.name: onErrorPropagate
nestedComponents.description: Error handler used to propagate errors. It will rollback any transaction and not consume messages.

constructs.name: errorHandler
constructs.description: Allows the definition of internal selective handlers. It will route the error to the first handler that matches it. If there's no match, then a default error handler will be executed.

parameters.name: transactionalAction
parameters.description: The action to take regarding transactions. By default nothing will be done.

parameters.name: transactionType
parameters.description: Transaction type supported. Availability will depend on the runtime version, though LOCAL is always available.

constructs.name: try
constructs.description: Processes the nested list of message processors, within a transaction and with it's own error handler if required.

parameters.name: schedulerName
parameters.description: Name that will be used to name the async scheduler

constructs.name: async
constructs.description: Processes the nested list of message processors asynchronously using a thread pool

parameters.name: parallel
parameters.description: Whether the configured routes will run in parallel (default is true).

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Sets a timeout in milliseconds for each route. Values lower or equals than zero means no timeout.

parameters.name: customAggregationStrategy
parameters.description: Allows customizing the logic used for aggregation the events back together.

constructs.name: scatterGather
constructs.description: Sends the same message to multiple message processors in parallel.

description.value: The maximum number of times a message can be redelivered and processed unsuccessfully before triggering process-failed-message
Whether to use a secure hash algorithm to identify a redelivered message
The secure hashing algorithm to use. If not set, the default is SHA-256.
Defines one or more expressions to use to determine when a message has been redelivered. This property may only be set if useSecureHash is false.
The object store where the redelivery counter for each message is going to be stored.

parameters.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameters.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

description.value: How many reconnection attempts to make
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

messageSources.name: scheduler
messageSources.description: Source that schedules periodic execution of a flow.
